name: places/ChIJb-2nNxD2wokRQniO2lJjXbI
formattedAddress: 60 W 116th St, New York, NY 10026, USA
adrFormatAddress: 60 W 116th St, New York, NY 10026-2298, USA

originalText.text:
This place is nothing short of amazing. Very clean place, everywhere I looked someone was either scrubbing the wall or cleaning the floor. A Vast selection of seafood to choose from, if it swims they sell it.
If you prefer your seafood steamed do yourself a favor and allow them to season it, the seasoning along with a scoop of melted butter will go perfect with your order. Great staff, reasonable prices .

originalText.text: I purchased 18 blue crabs for $30. Some Red Fish, and jumbo shrimp. Giant male crabs. Excellent price they were fresh. Great spot for see food.

text.text: I purchased 18 blue crabs for $30. Some Red Fish, and jumbo shrimp. Giant male crabs. Excellent price they were fresh. Great spot for see food.

originalText.text:
Fresh steamed broil - so DELICIOUS. Went in a Sunday when everything was fully stocked.

The process for isn’t necessarily obvious your first time, but people are helpful! The steps are as follows: You walk-in and grab a metal bowl on the left. Fill it with seafood by weight, grab some garlic, rosemary, in the middle. There are vegetable add ins too. Then go to the back for the cashier to weigh it and pay. They wash the seafood and give it back to you with an order number. Bring to the very front right of the steaming/frying counter and they will add the spices you want! Takes about 15min to steam, then loads of butter and other sauces to your liking are added!

Next time I want to try the fish fry’s and just buying any of their regular wholesale fish/crustations. All has great prices.

originalText.text: **DONT EAT HERE NO MORE!! I CAUGHT FOOD POISONING! This fish market has been a staple in East Harlem for years and it’s known for its fresh seafood. But ever since Covid came along they have fell off drastically! The fish that sits on ice is covered  by brown dirty ice and the fish eyes are red/brown. Good fish should still have a clear color indicating the freshness! I stopped eating the mussels from here for a few months because I witness not so fresh spoiled like muscles on ICE?! Just my luck I tried it over a weekend and instantly caught diarrhea and nausea. They need to be screened by the department of hygiene and be re-graded . Because this isn’t okay! Not buying from here no more unless it’s  renovated or a new owner with different staff comes to straighten things.

originalText.text: If you see something disturbing, WRITE about it! Last week, at Sea & Sea Fish Market: 116th St., off Lenox Avenue (Harlem, New York City) I witnessed a male Hispanic immigrant worker using the SAME shovel (taken straight from a bin of similar, dirty-white shovels) they use for the ice that covers the 'fresh' fish as a DUST PAN to scoop up and place in a garbage bin TRASH from the floor. (He then placed the shovel BACK with the others). This isn't a one-off: it's indicative of a much wider, much larger problem in Harlem: this is TYPICAL of how non-Black immigrant businesses and non-Black immigrant workers treat Blacks in New York, New York City. If the CDC is interested in the HEALTH disparities between Black Americans and other races (including the maternal death rate), then RESPOND accordingly. If the WORLD is wondering WHY there aren't MORE sub-three Black marathoners from the Black American community, then RESPOND accordingly. My body is NOT a trash receptacle. As a Black American woman, I am no better equipped to overcome bacteria INTENTIONALLY introduced into the food supply, by non-Blacks who do not treat people like me as a human, than any other race. I am not livestock: do NOT use the SAME tools that come in contact with food you SELL to me to feed my family to also clean your floors. I am an American citizen. I am a human being. Black Americans deserve better.
